page.title: 15DARTINGTON'S HISTORY
page.content: Dartington is first mentioned in a Saxon charter in 833 when LADY BEORGWYN owned "the farm by the Dart",an early Saxon settlement in Celtic Devonshire. John Holland,Duke of Exeter,half brother to Richard II,built Dartington Hall in 1388.Over the years its fortune changed.It was in a derelict condition when Dorothy and Leonard Elmhirst bought the hall in 1925 and began their imaginative and exciting programme in rural reconstruction.This project was to affect and enrich the local community. As well as creating jobs in forestry, agnculture, horticulture, pottery and textiles, joinery and the world famous Dartington glass factory, the arts and education were encouraged. Co-existing with the Hall, yet independent of it, is the lively village with the amenities of a small town.
